revised_title: A Study of Epidermal Structures and Feather Development in Birds
tldr: This study examines the development of feathers in birds, focusing on the epidermal structures and their sequence from embryo to adult. The research investigates various bird species, including domestic fowls, ducklings, and nestling starlings, to understand the different types of feathers and their growth patterns. The findings provide insights into the evolution of feathers and their relation to reptilian scales, as well as the phylogenetic sequence of events in feather development.
